intro: Craterispermum schweinfurthii, commonly known as the Schwerin's rockcress, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cress species. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, clustered leaves and bright yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
